Dude, you crack me up.  You are either a troll of the most epic sort, or an uneducated loser.  

You sound genuinely bitter, so my guess is that you have no job, no car, and live with your parents, possibly in a beat up double-wide trailer or government housing.  I'm giving you the benefit of the doubt that your parents are still married and that your mom hasn't moved in with the gas station janitor she's been banging.  You should get used to calling him daddy.  

If your life sucks, it's because you're dumb or lazy and you can't accept responsibility for your own failure.  You should learn to deal with that, or at least learn to enjoy the shit jobs you'll be doing for the rest of your life.  Good luck dipshit!

I am not a racist.  I never knew what a Jew was until I was about 12 years old.  All I knew was that they dressed different.  My mom told me they were holy people but she had second thoughts about that after I told her about the following things I had seen those funny people do:

1. Called me over to a car, and when I got there simply looked down.  He was masturbating. I man with long red curls and a beanie.

2. I was walking down the street a few blocks from my house in Borough Park, I was 8 years old. Suddenly I was slammed against a fence and a tall man yelled "Watch where you're going!" I remember the Abe Lincoln type hat, black coat and long curls.

3. At Coney Island I saw a black woman with tight shorts and very revealing clothing pacing up and down the street.  A large black car pulled up and I saw one of those strange people in it.  The prostitute got in. He wore the same black hat with a thick beard and curls.

Now...No other religion/race has ever pushed me and hurt me that way, I was 8. Even the middle eastern people in my neighborhood were kind and spoke to me. Never the Jews. 

No other religion or race has ever called me over to a car and masturbated.

I live in Sea Gate and there is a small park there. I took my soon there to play and he began playing with a Jewish kid of about 5 years old.  The little Jewish kid had a beanie and long curls. The mother took him away.  This happened several times with different children and I finally started taking my son to a different park.  I met someone else there from seagate who had the same experience.  

Now, I do not doubt there are good Jews and I think it is wrong to generalize, but here we have a people that have been hated throughout history, hated until this very day.  Is it for no other reason other than what they believe???


The problem is that their beliefs, their religion, is what dictates their behavior and for lack of a better word I can only associate it with hatred.
